translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The Fourteenth Section🔽Discussion of the Unrevealed
Is a false view unrevealed?

analyzed: āmantā  vipāka abyākatam kiriyā abyākatam rūpam nibbānam cakkhu āyatanam pe
translated: Agreed.
Is the unrevealed form that is a result, the unrevealed form that is a product, Nibbāna, the eye faculty … the body faculty … the tangible-object faculty unrevealed?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
Is a false view unrevealed?
Agreed.
Is the contact associated with a false view unrevealed?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
Is a false view unrevealed?

analyzed: āmantā  diṭṭhigata sampayuttā vedanā pe  saññā pe  cetanā pe
translated: Agreed.
Are the feeling … the perception … the volition … the consciousness associated with a false view unrevealed?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
Is the contact associated with a false view unskilful?
Agreed.

analyzed: diṭṭhigatam akusalanti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: Is a false view unskilful?🔽No.

original: diṭṭhigatasampayuttā vedanā saññā cetanā cittaṁ akusalanti?
analyzed: diṭṭhi gata sampayuttā vedanā saññā cetanā cittam akusalanti
translated: Are the feeling … the perception … the volition … the consciousness associated with a false view unskilful?
Agreed.
Is a false view unskilful?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
Is a false view unrevealed?
Agreed.
Is it fruitless and without result?
“No, friend.”

analyzed: nanu sa phalam sa vipākam ti
translated: “Then is it fruitful and has results?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci saphalaṁ savipākaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci sa phalam sa vipāka no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Is it fruitful and has results, and is it indeterminate?”
“No, friend.”
“Then is wrong view indeterminate?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: nanu micchādiṭṭhi paramāni vajjāni vuttāni bhagavatā ati
translated: “But, friend, haven’t wrong views been spoken of by the Blessed One as the worst of the bad things a person can do?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci micchādiṭṭhiparamāni vajjāni vuttāni bhagavatā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci micchādiṭṭhi paramāni vajjāni vuttāni bhagavatā no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Then is wrong view indeterminate?”

analyzed: diṭṭhigatam a byākatam ti  diṭṭhigatam a byākatam ti  āmantā
translated: “No, friend.”
“But, friend, hasn’t it been said by the Blessed One:

original: “micchādiṭṭhi kho, vaccha, akusalā, sammādiṭṭhi kusalā”ti.🔽Attheva suttantoti?
analyzed: micchā diṭṭhi kho vaccha akusalā sammā diṭṭhi kusalā ati  atthā iva suttanto ti
translated: ‘Wrong view, Vaccha, is unwholesome.’?”

analyzed: āmantā  tena hi na vattabba  diṭṭhigatam a byākatam ti
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Then is wrong view indeterminate?”

analyzed: diṭṭhigatam a byākatam ti  āmantā  nanu vuttam bhagavatā
translated: “No, friend.”🔽“But, friend, hasn’t it been said by the Blessed One:

original: “micchādiṭṭhissa kho ahaṁ, puṇṇa, dvinnaṁ gatīnaṁ aññataraṁ gatiṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhissa kho aha puṇṇa dvinnam gatīnam aññataram gatim vadāmi
translated: ‘Wrong view, Punna, leads to one of two destinies:
either hell or the animal realm’?”
Is there such a discourse?
Yes.

analyzed: diṭṭhigatam a byākatam ti  na vattabba  diṭṭhigatam a byākatam ti
translated: Then you shouldn’t say that a view is indeterminate.
You shouldn’t say that a view is indeterminate.
But hasn’t this been said by the Buddha?

original: “‘sassato loko’ti kho, vaccha, abyākatametaṁ,🔽‘asassato loko’ti kho, vaccha, abyākatametaṁ,🔽‘antavā loko’ti kho, vaccha, abyākatametaṁ,
analyzed: sassataḥ kho vaccha  a sassataḥ lokaḥ ti kho vaccha  kho
translated: ‘Vaccha, “The cosmos is eternal” is indecisive.🔽“The cosmos is not eternal” is indecisive.🔽“The cosmos is finite” is indecisive.

original: ‘anantavā loko’ti kho, vaccha …pe…🔽‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti kho, vaccha …pe…🔽‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti kho, vaccha …pe…
analyzed: kho vaccha pe  tam jīvam tam kho vaccha pe  aññam jīvam aññam sarīran ti kho vaccha pe
translated: “The cosmos is infinite” is indecisive.

analyzed: hoti tathāgataḥ param kho vaccha pe
translated: “A Realized One exists after death” is indecisive.

original: ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, vaccha …pe…🔽‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, vaccha …pe…
analyzed: na hoti tathāgataḥ param kho vaccha pe  hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgataḥ param kho vaccha pe
translated: “A Realized One doesn’t exist after death” is indecisive.🔽“A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death” is indecisive.

original: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, vaccha, abyākatametan”ti.
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param kho vaccha a byākatam etat ti
translated: “A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death” is indecisive.’
Is there such a discourse?
Yes.

analyzed: tena hi diṭṭhigatam a byākatam ti
translated: “Well then, is a view that’s a form of conceit neutral?”
“Is a view that’s a form of conceit neutral?”
“Yes.”
“But hasn’t it been said by the Buddha that

analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikassa bhikkhave purisa puggalassa yat ca iva kāya kammam
translated: a person with wrong view, whose activities are dominated by wrong view,

original: samādinnaṁ, yañca vacīkammaṁ …pe… yañca manokammaṁ, yā ca cetanā, yā ca patthanā,🔽yo ca paṇidhi, ye ca saṅkhārā, sabbe te dhammā aniṭṭhāya akantāya amanāpāya ahitāya🔽dukkhāya saṁvattantī”ti.
analyzed: yat ca vacī kammam pe yat ca manaḥ kamma yā ca cetanā yā ca patthanā  yaḥ ca paṇidhi ye ca saṅkhārā sabbe te dhammā aniṭṭhāya a kantāya a manāpāya ahitāya  dukkhāya savattanti iti
translated: will—on the breakup of the body, after death—reappear in a lower place, a bad destination, a world of suffering, hell?
“Is there such a suttanta?”
“Yes.”
“Well then, you shouldn’t say that
a view that’s a form of conceit is neutral.”
The discussion of the neutral is finished.
